fields.name: ablation_distance_between_shots_x_units
fields.description: Units of x resolution distance between laser ablation shots.

fields.name: ablation_distance_between_shots_x_value
fields.description: x resolution. Distance between laser ablation shots in the X-dimension.

fields.name: ablation_distance_between_shots_y_units
fields.description: Units of y resolution distance between laser ablation shots.

fields.name: ablation_distance_between_shots_y_value
fields.description: y resolution. Distance between laser ablation shots in the Y-dimension.

fields.name: ablation_frequency_unit
fields.description: Frequency unit of laser ablation

fields.name: ablation_frequency_value
fields.description: Frequency value of laser ablation

fields.name: acquisition_id
fields.description: The acquisition_id refers to the directory containing the ROI images for a slide. Together, the "Acquisition ID" and the "ROI ID" indicate the slide-ROI represented in the image.

fields.name: acquisition_instrument_model
fields.description: Manufacturers of an acquisition instrument may offer various versions (models) of that instrument with different features or sensitivities. Differences in features or sensitivities may be relevant to processing or interpretation of the data.

fields.name: acquisition_instrument_vendor
fields.description: An acquisition instrument is the device that contains the signal detection hardware and signal processing software. Assays generate signals such as light of various intensities or color or signals representing the molecular mass.

fields.name: amount_of_input_analyte_unit
fields.description: Units of amount of entity input to assay value

fields.name: amount_of_input_analyte_value
fields.description: The amount of RNA or DNA input to the assay, typically measured by a Qubit, BioAnalyzer, or TapeStation. In most single cell/nuclei assays, this value isn't available.

fields.name: analyte_class
fields.description: Analytes are the target molecules being measured with the assay.

fields.name: area_normalized_ion_dose_unit
fields.description: Area normalized ion dose unit.

fields.name: area_normalized_ion_dose_value
fields.description: Number of primary ions delivered to the sample per unit area.

fields.name: assay_category
fields.description: Each assay is placed into one of the following 4 general categories: generation of images of microscopic entities, identification & quantitation of molecules by mass spectrometry, imaging mass spectrometry, and determination of nucleotide sequence.

fields.name: assay_input_entity
fields.description: This is the entity from which the analyte is being captured. For example, for bulk sequencing this would be "tissue", while it would be "single cell" for single cell sequencing. This field is used to determine which analysis pipeline to run.

fields.name: assay_type
fields.description: The specific type of assay being executed.

fields.name: barcode_offset
fields.description: Positions in the read at which the cell or capture spot barcodes start. Cell and capture spot barcodes are, for example, 3 x 8 bp sequences that are spaced by constant sequences (the offsets). First barcode at position 0, then 38, then 76. This should be included when constructing sequencing libraries with a non-commercial kit.

fields.name: barcode_read
fields.description: Which read file contains the cell or capture spot barcode. This should be included when constructing sequencing libraries with a non-commercial kit. This field is required if the source material is barcoded. This field is used to determine which analysis pipeline to run.

fields.name: barcode_size
fields.description: Length of the cell or capture spot barcode in base pairs. Cell and capture spot barcodes are, for example, 3 x 8 bp sequences that are spaced by constant sequences, the offsets. This should be included when constructing sequencing libraries with a non-commercial kit. This field is required if the source material is barcoded.  This field is used to determine which analysis pipeline to run.

fields.name: bead_barcode_offset
fields.description: Position(s) in the read at which the bead barcode starts

fields.name: bead_barcode_read
fields.description: Which read file contains the bead barcode

fields.name: bead_barcode_size
fields.description: Length of the bead barcode in base pairs

fields.name: bulk_atac_cell_isolation_protocols_io_doi
fields.description: Link to a protocols document answering the question: How was tissue stored and processed for cell/nuclei isolation

fields.name: bulk_rna_isolation_protocols_io_doi
fields.description: Link to a protocols document answering the question: How was tissue stored and processed for RNA isolation RNA_isolation_protocols_io_doi

fields.name: bulk_rna_isolation_quality_metric_value
fields.description: RIN value

fields.name: bulk_rna_yield_units_per_tissue_unit
fields.description: RNA amount per Tissue input amount. Valid values should be weight/weight (ng/mg).

fields.name: bulk_rna_yield_value
fields.description: RNA (ng) per Weight of Tissue (mg). Answer the question: How much RNA in ng was isolated? How much tissue in mg was initially used for isolating RNA? Calculate the yield by dividing total RNA isolated by amount of tissue used to isolate RNA from (ng/mg).

fields.name: bulk_transposition_input_number_nuclei
fields.description: A number (no comma separators)

fields.name: capture_area_id
fields.description: Which capture area on the slide was used. For Visium this would be [A1, B1, C1, D1]. For HiFi this would be the lane on the flowcell.

fields.name: capture_batch_id
fields.description: A lab-generated ID to identify which cells were captured at the same time. This would, for example, be an ID to denote which datasets were derived from a single 10X Genomics Chromium Controller run. In the case of the 10X Controller this could be the chip ID and would allow users the ability to determine which samples were processed together in a Chromium controller. It is recommended that data providers prefix the ID with the center name, to prevent values overlapping across centers.

fields.name: cell_barcode_offset
fields.description: Position(s) in the read at which the cell barcode starts.

fields.name: cell_barcode_read
fields.description: Which read file contains the cell barcode

fields.name: cell_barcode_size
fields.description: Length of the cell barcode in base pairs

fields.name: cell_boundary_marker_or_stain
fields.description: If a marker or stain was used to identify all cell boundaries in the tissue, then the name of the marker or stain should be included here. The name of the antibody-targeted molecule marker or non-antibody targeted molecule stain included here must be identical to what is found in the imaging data. For example, with the PhenoCycler, this name must match the value found in the XPD output file. If multiple marker or stains are used to identify all cell boundaries, then a comma separated list should be used here.

fields.name: data_collection_mode
fields.description: Mode of data collection in tandem MS assays. Either DDA (Data-dependent acquisition), DIA (Data-independent acquisition), SRM (multiple reaction monitoring), or PRM (parallel reaction monitoring).

fields.name: data_precision_bytes
fields.description: Numerical data precision in bytes.

fields.name: dataset_type
fields.description: The specific type of dataset being produced.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Free-text description of this assay.

fields.name: desi_solvent
fields.description: Solvent composition for conducting nanospray desorption electrospray ionization (nanoDESI) or desorption electrospray ionization (DESI).

fields.name: desi_solvent_flow_rate
fields.description: The rate of flow of the solvent into a spray.

fields.name: desi_solvent_flow_rate_unit
fields.description: Units of the rate of solvent flow.

fields.name: dms
fields.description: Was differential mobility spectrometry used in this assay?

fields.name: dna_assay_input_unit
fields.description: Units of DNA input into library preparation

fields.name: dna_assay_input_value
fields.description: Amount of DNA input into library preparation

fields.name: dual_count_start
fields.description: Threshold for dual counting.

fields.name: end_datetime
fields.description: Time stamp indicating end of ablation for ROI

fields.name: execution_datetime
fields.description: Start date and time of assay, typically a date-time stamped folder generated by the acquisition instrument. YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm, where YYYY is the year, MM is the month with leading 0s, and DD is the day with leading 0s, hh is the hour with leading zeros, mm are the minutes with leading zeros.

fields.name: expected_cell_count
fields.description: How many cells are expected? This may be used in downstream pipelines to guide selection of cell barcodes or segmentation parameters.

fields.name: expected_entity_capture_count
fields.description: Number of cells, nuclei or capture spots expected to be captured by the assay. For Visium this is the total number of spots covered by tissue, within the capture area.

fields.name: gdna_fragmentation_quality_assurance
fields.description: Is the gDNA integrity good enough for WGS? This is usually checked through running a gel.

fields.name: increment_z_unit
fields.description: The units of increment z value.

fields.name: increment_z_value
fields.description: The distance between sequential optical sections.

fields.name: intended_tile_overlap_percentage
fields.description: The amount of overlap between tiled images. This is the set point, where as during image acquisition there will be slight variations due to stage registration.

fields.name: ion_mobility
fields.description: Specifies which technology was used for ion mobility spectrometry. Technologies for measuring ion mobility: Traveling Wave Ion Mobility Spectrometry (TWIMS), Trapped Ion Mobility Spectrometry (TIMS), High Field Asymmetric waveform ion Mobility Spectrometry (FAIMS), Drift Tube Ion Mobility Spectrometry (DTIMS), Structures for Lossless Ion Manipulations (SLIM), and cyclic Ion Mobility Spectrometry (cIMS).

fields.name: is_batch_staining_done
fields.description: Are the slides stained using a linear batch method or individually?

fields.name: is_image_preprocessing_required
fields.description: Depending on if the acquisition instrument was a microscope, slide scanner, etc. will indicate whether or not any level of preprocessing was required to assemble the image (e.g., fusing image tiles) .

fields.name: is_staining_automated
fields.description: Is the slide staining automated with an instrument?

fields.name: is_targeted
fields.description: Specifies whether or not a specific molecule(s) is/are targeted for detection/measurement by the assay ("Yes" or "No"). The CODEX analyte is protein.

fields.name: is_technical_replicate
fields.description: Is the sequencing reaction run in replicate, "Yes" or "No". If "Yes", FASTQ files in dataset need to be merged.

fields.name: label_name
fields.description: If the samples were labeled (e.g. TMT), provide the name/ID of the label on this sample. Leave blank if not applicable.

fields.name: labeling
fields.description: Indicates whether samples were labeled prior to MS analysis (e.g., TMT)

fields.name: lc_column_model
fields.description: The model number/name of the liquid chromatography column. If it is a custom self-packed, pulled tip capillary is used enter “Pulled tip capilary”.

fields.name: lc_column_vendor
fields.description: The manufacturer of the liquid chromatography column unless self-packed, pulled tip capillary is used.

fields.name: lc_flow_rate_unit
fields.description: Units of flow rate.

fields.name: lc_flow_rate_value
fields.description: Value of flow rate.

fields.name: lc_gradient
fields.description: LC gradient

fields.name: lc_id_unit
fields.description: units of LC column inner diameter (typically microns)

fields.name: lc_id_value
fields.description: LC column inner diameter (microns)

fields.name: lc_instrument_model
fields.description: The model number/name of the instrument used for liquid chromatography.

fields.name: lc_instrument_vendor
fields.description: The manufacturer of the instrument used for liquid chromatography.

fields.name: lc_length_unit
fields.description: units for LC column length (typically cm)

fields.name: lc_length_value
fields.description: LC column length

fields.name: lc_mobile_phase_a
fields.description: Composition of mobile phase A.

fields.name: lc_mobile_phase_b
fields.description: Composition of mobile phase B

fields.name: lc_resin
fields.description: Details of the resin used for liquid chromatography, including vendor, particle size, pore size.

fields.name: lc_temp_unit
fields.description: units for LC temperature

fields.name: lc_temp_value
fields.description: LC temperature

fields.name: library_adapter_sequence
fields.description: 5’ and/or 3’ read adapter sequences used as part of the library preparation protocol to render the library compatible with the sequencing protocol and instrumentation. This should be provided as comma-separated list of key:value pairs (adapter name:sequence).

fields.name: library_average_fragment_size
fields.description: Average size of sequencing library fragments estimated via gel electrophoresis or bioanalyzer/tapestation. Numeric value in base pairs (bp).

fields.name: library_concentration_unit
fields.description: Unit of library concentration value.

fields.name: library_concentration_value
fields.description: The concentration value of the pooled library samples submitted for sequencing.

fields.name: library_construction_method
fields.description: Describes DNA library preparation kit. Modality of isolating gDNA, Fragmentation and generating sequencing libraries.

fields.name: library_construction_protocols_io_doi
fields.description: A link to the protocol document containing the library construction method (including version) that was used.

fields.name: library_creation_date
fields.description: date and time of library creation. YYYY-MM-DD, where YYYY is the year, MM is the month with leading 0s, and DD is the day with leading 0s.

fields.name: library_final_yield
fields.description: Total ng of library after final pcr amplification step.

fields.name: library_final_yield_unit
fields.description: Units of final library yield

fields.name: library_final_yield_value
fields.description: Total number of ng of library after final pcr amplification step. This is the concentration (ng/ul) * volume (ul)

fields.name: library_id
fields.description: An id for the library. The id may be text and/or numbers

fields.name: library_input_amount_unit
fields.description: unit of library input amount value

fields.name: library_input_amount_value
fields.description: The amount of cDNA, after amplification, that was used for library construction.

fields.name: library_layout
fields.description: Whether the library was generated for single-end or paired end sequencing

fields.name: library_output_amount_unit
fields.description: Units of library final yield.

fields.name: library_output_amount_value
fields.description: Total amount (eg. nanograms) of library after the clean-up step of final pcr amplification step. Answer the question: What is the Qubit measured concentration (ng/ul) times the elution volume (ul) after the final clean-up step?

fields.name: library_pcr_cycles
fields.description: Number of PCR cycles to amplify cDNA

fields.name: library_pcr_cycles_for_sample_index
fields.description: Number of PCR cycles performed for library indexing

fields.name: library_preparation_kit
fields.description: Reagent kit used for library preparation

fields.name: mapped_area_unit
fields.description: The unit of measurement for the mapping area. For Visium and GeoMx this is typically um^2.

fields.name: mapped_area_value
fields.description: For Visium, this is the area of spots that was covered by tissue within the captured area, not the total possible captured area which is fixed. For GeoMx this would be the area of the AOI being captured. For HiFi this is the summed area of the ROIs in a single flowcell lane. For CosMx, Xenium and Resolve, this is the area of the FOV (aka ROI) region being captured.

fields.name: mass_resolving_power
fields.description: The mass resolving power m/∆m, where ∆m is defined as the full width at half-maximum (FWHM) for a given peak with a specified mass-to-charge (m/z). (unitless)

fields.name: max_x_width_unit
fields.description: Units of image width of the ROI acquisition

fields.name: max_x_width_value
fields.description: Image width value of the ROI acquisition

fields.name: max_y_height_unit
fields.description: Units of image height of the ROI acquisition

fields.name: max_y_height_value
fields.description: Image height value of the ROI acquisition

fields.name: metadata_schema_id
fields.description: The string that serves as the definitive identifier for the metadata schema version and is readily interpretable by computers for data validation and processing. Example: 22bc762a-5020-419d-b170-24253ed9e8d9

fields.name: ms_scan_mode
fields.description: MS (mass spectrometry) scan mode refers to the number of steps in the separation of fragments.

fields.name: ms_source
fields.description: The ion source type used for surface sampling.

fields.name: mz_range_high_value
fields.description: The high value of the scanned mass range for MS1. (unitless)

fields.name: mz_range_low_value
fields.description: The low value of the scanned mass range for MS1. (unitless)

fields.name: mz_resolving_power
fields.description: The peak (m/z) used to calculate the resolving power.

fields.name: non_global_files
fields.description: A semicolon separated list of non-shared files to be included in the dataset. The path assumes the files are located in the "TOP/non-global/" directory. For example, for the file is TOP/non-global/lab_processed/images/1-tissue-boundary.geojson the value of this field would be "./lab_processed/images/1-tissue-boundary.geojson". After ingest, these files will be copied to the appropriate locations within the respective dataset directory tree. This field is used for internal HuBMAP processing. Examples for GeoMx and PhenoCycler are provided in the File Locations documentation: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1n2McSs9geA9Eli4QWQaB3c9R3wo5d5U1Xd57DWQfN5Q/edit#heading=h.1u82i4axggee

fields.name: nuclear_marker_or_stain
fields.description: For markers, an antibody-targetted molecule present in or around the cell nucleus, the protein or gene symbol that identifies the antibody target that is used as the nuclear marker. This symbol must match the antibody target that is either generated from the panel used or entered with custom panels. Preferably, if using a custom antibody marker, this symbol should be the HGNC symbol (https://www.genenames.org/).   For non-protein targets this is the stain name (e.g., DAPI) and, when appropriate, associated staining kit and vendor. For the PhenoCycler, this symbol must match the value found in the XPD output file.

fields.name: number_of_antibodies
fields.description: Number of antibodies

fields.name: number_of_barcode_probes
fields.description: Number of barcode probes targeting mRNAs (eg. 24,000 barcode probes = 24,000 mRNAs - 1 per mRNA of interest)

fields.name: number_of_barcode_regions_per_barcode_probe
fields.description: Number of barcode regions on each mRNA barcode probe (the paper describes mRNA probes with 4 barcoded regions)

fields.name: number_of_biomarker_imaging_rounds
fields.description: Number of imaging rounds to capture the tagged biomarkers. For CODEX a biomarker imaging round consists of 1. oligo application, 2. fluor application, 3. washes. For Cell DIVE a biomarker imaging round consists of 1. staining of a biomarker via secondary detection or direct conjugate and 2. dye inactivation.

fields.name: number_of_channels
fields.description: Number of fluorescent channels imaged during each cycle.

fields.name: number_of_cycles
fields.description: Number of cycles of 1. oligo application, 2. fluor application, 3. washes

fields.name: number_of_imaging_rounds
fields.description: the total number of acquisitions performed on microscope to collect autofluorescence/background or stained signal.

fields.name: number_of_input_cells_or_nuclei
fields.description: How many cells or nuclei were input to the assay? This is typically not available for preparations working with bulk tissue.

fields.name: number_of_iterations_of_cdna_amplification
fields.description: This is the amplification of the cDNA prior to library construction. This is typically a PCR amplification, while for linear amplification methods like aRNA this would be the number of rounds of aRNA.

fields.name: number_of_pcr_cycles_for_indexing
fields.description: Number of PCR cycles performed in order to add adapters and amplify the library. This does not include the cDNA amplification which is captured in the "number of iterations of cDNA amplification" field.

fields.name: number_of_pre_amplification_pcr_cycles
fields.description: The number of PCR cycles run after the Chromium Controller step and prior to separating the suspension and initiating library construction

fields.name: number_of_pseudocolors_per_channel
fields.description: Number of pseudocolors that can be assigned to each fluorescent channel (the paper describes 20 pseudocolors per channel (x 3 channels -> total = 60)

fields.name: number_of_readout_probes_per_channel
fields.description: Number of readout probes that can be interrogated per channel per cycle (the paper describes 20 readout probes per channel (x 3 channels -> total = 60))

fields.name: number_of_sections
fields.description: Number of sections

fields.name: number_of_spots
fields.description: Number of capture spots within the mapped area. For Visium this would be the number of spots covered by tissue, while it's the number of spots within ROIs for HiFi.

fields.name: number_of_total_imaging_rounds
fields.description: The total number of acquisitions performed on microscope to collect autofluorescence/background or stained signal (e.g., histology).

fields.name: operator
fields.description: Name of the person responsible for executing the assay.

fields.name: operator_email
fields.description: Email address for the operator.

fields.name: overall_protocols_io_doi
fields.description: DOI for protocols.io for the overall process.

fields.name: parent_sample_id
fields.description: Unique HuBMAP or SenNet identifier of the sample (i.e., block, section or suspension) used to perform this assay. For example, for a RNAseq assay, the parent would be the suspension, whereas, for one of the imaging assays, the parent would be the tissue section. If an assay comes from multiple parent samples then this should be a comma separated list. Example: HBM386.ZGKG.235, HBM672.MKPK.442 or SNT232.UBHJ.322, SNT329.ALSK.102

fields.name: permeabilization_time_unit
fields.description: The unit for the permeabilization time.

fields.name: permeabilization_time_value
fields.description: Permeabilization time used for this tissue section.

fields.name: pi
fields.description: Name of the principal investigator responsible for the data.

fields.name: pi_email
fields.description: Email address for the principal investigator.

fields.name: pixel_dwell_time_unit
fields.description: Pixel dwell time unit.

fields.name: pixel_dwell_time_value
fields.description: Resident time of primary ion beam on each pixel to ionize it.

fields.name: pixel_size_x_unit
fields.description: Width unit of the pixel or voxel measurement.

fields.name: pixel_size_x_value
fields.description: Width value of the pixel or voxel measurement (distinct from the image resolution_x_value).

fields.name: pixel_size_y_unit
fields.description: Length unit of the pixel or voxel measurement.

fields.name: pixel_size_y_value
fields.description: Length value of the pixel or voxel measurement (distinct from the image resolution_y_value).

fields.name: polarity
fields.description: The polarity of the mass analysis (positive or negative ion modes)

fields.name: preparation_instrument_kit
fields.description: The reagent kit used with the preparation instrument.

fields.name: preparation_instrument_model
fields.description: Manufacturers of a staining system instrument may offer various versions (models) of that instrument with different features. Differences in features or sensitivities may be relevant to processing or interpretation of the data.

fields.name: preparation_instrument_vendor
fields.description: The manufacturer of the instrument used to prepare (staining/processing) the sample for the assay. If an automatic slide staining method was indicated this field should list the manufacturer of the instrument.

fields.name: preparation_maldi_matrix
fields.description: The matrix is a compound of crystallized molecules that acts like a buffer between the sample and the laser. It also helps ionize the sample, carrying it along the flight tube so it can be detected.

fields.name: preparation_protocol_doi
fields.description: DOI for the protocols.io page that describes the assay or sample procurment and preparation. For example for an imaging assay, the protocol might include staining of a section through the creation of an OME-TIFF file. In this case the protocol would include any image processing steps required to create the OME-TIFF file. Example: https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.eq2lyno9qvx9/v1

fields.name: preparation_type
fields.description: Common methods of depositing matrix for MALDI imaging include robotic spotting, electrospray deposition, and spray-coating with an airbrush.

fields.name: primary_ion
fields.description: Primary ion.

fields.name: primary_ion_current_unit
fields.description: Primary ion current unit, typically nA or pA

fields.name: primary_ion_current_value
fields.description: Primary ion current value.

fields.name: processing_protocols_io_doi
fields.description: DOI for analysis protocols.io for this assay.

fields.name: processing_search
fields.description: Software for analyzing and searching LC-MS/MS omics data

fields.name: protocols_io_doi
fields.description: DOI for protocols.io referring to the protocol for this assay.

fields.name: puck_id
fields.description: Slide-seq captures RNA sequence data on spatially barcoded arrays of beads. Beads are fixed to a slide in a region shaped like a round puck. Each puck has a unique puck_id.

fields.name: range_z_unit
fields.description: The unit of range_z_value.

fields.name: range_z_value
fields.description: The total range of the z axis.

fields.name: reagent_prep_protocols_io_doi
fields.description: DOI for protocols.io referring to the protocol for preparing reagents for the assay.

fields.name: resolution_x_unit
fields.description: The unit of measurement of the width of a pixel.

fields.name: resolution_x_value
fields.description: The width of a pixel.

fields.name: resolution_y_unit
fields.description: The unit of measurement of the height of a pixel.

fields.name: resolution_y_value
fields.description: The height of a pixel

fields.name: resolution_z_unit
fields.description: The unit of incremental distance between image slices.

fields.name: resolution_z_value
fields.description: The distance at which two objects along the detection z-axis can be distinguished (resolved as 2 objects).

fields.name: rnaseq_assay_input
fields.description: Number of cell/nuclei input to the assay

fields.name: rnaseq_assay_input_unit
fields.description: Units of RNA input amount to the assay

fields.name: rnaseq_assay_input_value
fields.description: RNA input amount value to the assay

fields.name: rnaseq_assay_method
fields.description: The kit used for the RNA sequencing assay

fields.name: roi_description
fields.description: A description of the anatomical structure being captured in the region of interest (ROI).

fields.name: roi_id
fields.description: Multiple images are acquired from regions of interest (ROI1, ROI2, ROI3, etc) on a slide. The ROI ID is a number from 1 to N representing the ROI captured on a slide.

fields.name: sample_indexing_kit
fields.description: Indexes are needed for multiplexing sequencing libraries for simultaneous sequencing (pooling) and proper attachment to the Illumina flowcell. Each indexing kit would have a number of compatible sequences ("sample indexing sets") that are used to label some number of samples (the number of sets depend on the kit).

fields.name: sample_indexing_set
fields.description: The specific sequencing barcode index set used, selected from the sample indexing kit. Example: For 10X this might be "SI-GA-A1", for Nextera "N505 - CTCCTTAC"

fields.name: sample_quality_metric
fields.description: This is a quality metric by visual inspection. This should answer the question: Are the nuclei intact and are the nuclei free of significant amounts of debris? This can be captured at a high level, “OK” or “not OK”.

fields.name: sc_isolation_cell_number
fields.description: Total number of cell/nuclei yielded post dissociation and enrichment

fields.name: sc_isolation_enrichment
fields.description: The method by which specific cell populations are sorted or enriched.

fields.name: sc_isolation_entity
fields.description: The type of single cell entity derived from isolation protocol

fields.name: sc_isolation_protocols_io_doi
fields.description: Link to a protocols document answering the question: How were single cells separated into a single-cell suspension?

fields.name: sc_isolation_quality_metric
fields.description: A quality metric by visual inspection prior to cell lysis or defined by known parameters such as wells with several cells or no cells. This can be captured at a high level.

fields.name: sc_isolation_tissue_dissociation
fields.description: The method by which tissues are dissociated into single cells in suspension.

fields.name: scan_direction
fields.description: This is the direction of imaging, which is required for stitching.

fields.name: section_prep_protocols_io_doi
fields.description: DOI for protocols.io referring to the protocol for preparing tissue sections for the assay.

fields.name: segment_data_format
fields.description: This refers to the data type, which is a "float" for the IMC counts.

fields.name: sequencing_batch_id
fields.description: The ID for the sequencing run. This could, for example, be the chip ID and should allow users the ability to determine which samples were processed together in a sequencing run. It is recommended that data providers prefix the ID with the center name, to prevent values overlapping across centers.

fields.name: sequencing_phix_percent
fields.description: Percent PhiX loaded to the run

fields.name: sequencing_read_format
fields.description: Number of sequencing cycles in each round of sequencing (i.e., Read1, i7 index, i5 index, and Read2). This is reported as a comma-delimited list. Example: For 10X snATAC-seq (R1,Index,R2,R3) this might be: 50,8,16,50. For SNARE-seq2 this might be: 75,94,8,75

fields.name: sequencing_read_percent_q30
fields.description: Q30 is the weighted average of all the reads (e.g. # bases UMI * q30 UMI + # bases R2 * q30 R2 + ...)

fields.name: sequencing_reagent_kit
fields.description: Reagent kit used for sequencing

fields.name: signal_type
fields.description: Type of signal measured per channel (usually dual counts)

fields.name: slide_id
fields.description: A unique ID denoting the slide used. This allows users the ability to determine which tissue sections were processed together on the same slide. It is recommended that data providers prefix the ID with the center name, to prevent values overlapping across centers.

fields.name: source_project
fields.description: External source (outside of HuBMAP) of the project, eg. HCA (The Human Cell Atlas Consortium).

fields.name: source_storage_duration_unit
fields.description: The time duration unit of measurement

fields.name: source_storage_duration_value
fields.description: How long was the source material (parent) stored, prior to this sample being processed.

fields.name: spatial_sampling_type
fields.description: Specifies whether or not the analysis was performed in a spatially targeted manner. Spatial profiling experiments target specific tissue foci but do not necessarily generate images. Spatial imaging expriments collect data from a regular array (pixels) that can be visualized as heat maps of ion intensity at each location (molecular images). Leave blank if data are derived from bulk analysis.

fields.name: spatial_target
fields.description: Specifies the cell-type or functional tissue unit (FTU) that is targeted in the spatial profiling experiment. Leave blank if data are generated in imaging mode without a specific target structure.

fields.name: spatial_type
fields.description: Specifies whether or not the analysis was performed in a spatialy targeted manner and the technique used for spatial sampling. For example, Laser-capture microdissection (LCM), Liquid Extraction Surface Analysis (LESA), Nanodroplet Processing in One pot for Trace Samples (nanoPOTS).

fields.name: spot_size_unit
fields.description: The unit for spot size value.

fields.name: spot_size_value
fields.description: For assays where spots are used to define discrete capture areas, this is the area of a spot.

fields.name: spot_spacing_unit
fields.description: Units corresponding to inter-spot distance

fields.name: spot_spacing_value
fields.description: Approximate center-to-center distance between capture spots.  Synonyms: Inter-Spot distance, Spot resolution, Pit size

fields.name: stain
fields.description: Chemical stains (dyes) applied to histology samples to highlight important features of the tissue as well as to enhance the tissue contrast.

fields.name: stain_name
fields.description: The name of the chemical stains (dyes) applied to histology samples to highlight important features of the tissue as well as to enhance the tissue contrast.

fields.name: stain_technique
fields.description: There are typically three types of stains: progressive, modified progressive, and regressive. Progressive staining occurs when the hematoxylin is added to the tissue without being followed by a differentiator to remove excess dye. With regressive and modified progressive staining, a differentiator is used.

fields.name: start_datetime
fields.description: Time stamp indicating start of ablation for ROI

fields.name: step_z_value
fields.description: The number of optical sections in z axis range.

fields.name: tile_configuration
fields.description: This is how the tiles are configured for stitching.

fields.name: tiled_image_columns
fields.description: This is how many columns used in stitching. This is sometimes referred to as the grid size x.

fields.name: tiled_image_count
fields.description: This is the total number of raw (tiled) images captured, that are to be stitched together.

fields.name: time_since_acquisition_instrument_calibration_unit
fields.description: The time unit of measurement

fields.name: time_since_acquisition_instrument_calibration_value
fields.description: The amount of time since the acqusition instrument was last serviced by the vendor. This provides a metric for assessing drift in data capture.

fields.name: total_run_time_unit
fields.description: The units for the total run time unit field.

fields.name: total_run_time_value
fields.description: How long the tissue was on the acquisition instrument.

fields.name: transposition_input
fields.description: Number of cell/nuclei input to the assay.

fields.name: transposition_kit_number
fields.description: If Tn5 came from a kit, provide the catalog number.

fields.name: transposition_method
fields.description: Modality of capturing accessible chromatin molecules. For example, this would be the type of kit that was used.

fields.name: transposition_reagent_kit
fields.description: If Tn5 came from a kit, provide the kit details. This should be set to "Not applicable" if a custom or in-house kit was used.

fields.name: transposition_transposase_source
fields.description: The source of the Tn5 transposase and transposon used for capturing accessible chromatin.

fields.name: umi_offset
fields.description: Position in the read at which the UMI barcode starts. This should be included when constructing sequencing libraries with a non-commercial kit.

fields.name: umi_read
fields.description: Which read file contains the UMI barcode. This should be included when constructing sequencing libraries with a non-commercial kit.

fields.name: umi_size
fields.description: Length of the umi barcode in base pairs. This should be included when constructing sequencing libraries with a non-commercial kit. This field is required if UMI are present. This field is used to determine which analysis pipeline to run.

fields.name: age_unit
fields.description: Unit for age measurement.

fields.name: age_value
fields.description: The time elapsed since birth.

fields.name: body_mass_index_value
fields.description: An individual's weight in kilograms divided by the square of the height in meters.

fields.name: cause_of_death
fields.description: The circumstance or condition that caused death.

fields.name: height_unit
fields.description: Unit for height measurement.

fields.name: height_value
fields.description: The vertical measurement or distance from the base to the top of a subject or participant.

fields.name: kidney_donor_profile_index_value
fields.description: The Kidney Donor Profle Index (KDPI) is a numerical measure that combines ten donor factors, including clinical parameters and demographics, to summarize into a single number the quality of deceased donor kidneys relative to other recovered kidneys. The KDPI is derived by frst calculating the Kidney Donor Risk Index (KDRI) for a deceased donor. Kidneys from a donor with a KDPI of 90%, for example, have a KDRI (which indicates relative risk of graft failure) greater than 90% of recovered kidneys. The KDPI is simply a mapping of the KDRI from a relative risk scale to a cumulative percentage scale. The reference population used for this mapping is all deceased donors in the United States with a kidney recovered for the purpose of transplantation in the prior calendar year. Lower KDPI values are associated with increased donor quality and expected longevity. https://optn.transplant.hrsa.gov/media/1512/guide_to_calculating_interpreting_kdpi.pdf

fields.name: mechanism_of_injury
fields.description: Mechanism of injury may be, for example: fall, impact (eg: auto accident), weapon (eg: firearm), etc.

fields.name: medical_history
fields.description: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.

fields.name: race
fields.description: A grouping of humans based on shared physical characteristics or social/ethnic identity generally viewed as distinct.

fields.name: sex
fields.description: Biological sex at birth: male or female or other.

fields.name: weight_unit
fields.description: Weight unit

fields.name: weight_value
fields.description: Weight of the participant

fields.name: area_unit
fields.description: The area unit of measurement

fields.name: area_value
fields.description: The area of the sample section.

fields.name: cold_ischemia_time_unit
fields.description: Time unit

fields.name: cold_ischemia_time_value
fields.description: Time interval on ice to the start of preservation protocol.

fields.name: health_status
fields.description: Patient's baseline physical condition prior to immediate event leading to organ/tissue acquisition. For example, if a relatively healthy patient suffers trauma, and as a result of reparative surgery, a tissue sample is collected, the subject will be deemed “relatively healthy”.   Likewise, a relatively healthy subject may have experienced trauma leading to brain death.  As a result of organ donation, a sample is collected.  In this scenario, the subject is deemed “relatively healthy.”

fields.name: is_suspension_enriched
fields.description: Was the cell/nuclei population enriched?

fields.name: metadata_schema_id
fields.description: The string that serves as the definitive identifier for the metadata schema version and is readily interpretable by computers for data validation and processing. Example: 22bc762a-5020-419d-b170-24253ed9e8d9

fields.name: notes
fields.description: Miscellaneous details about the sample, not captured in the existing metadata fields.

fields.name: organ_condition
fields.description: Health status of the organ at the time of sample recovery.

fields.name: pathologist_report
fields.description: Further details on organ level QC checks.

fields.name: perfusion_solution
fields.description: Type of solution that was used to perfuse the organ.

fields.name: preparation_condition
fields.description: The condition by which the preparation occurred, such as was the sample placed in dry ice during the preparation.

fields.name: preparation_medium
fields.description: The medium used during the sample preparation

fields.name: preparation_protocol_doi
fields.description: DOI for the protocols.io page that describes the assay or sample procurment and preparation. For example for an imaging assay, the protocol might include staining of a section through the creation of an OME-TIFF file. In this case the protocol would include any image processing steps required to create the OME-TIFF file. Example: https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.eq2lyno9qvx9/v1

fields.name: procedure_date
fields.description: Date of procedure to procure organ.

fields.name: processing_time_unit
fields.description: The time unit of measurement

fields.name: processing_time_value
fields.description: How long the tissue was being handled before the initial preservation.

fields.name: quality_criteria
fields.description: For example, RIN: 8.7. For suspensions, measured by visual inspection prior to cell lysis or defined by known parameters such as wells with several cells or no cells. This can be captured at a high level. "OK" or "not OK", or with more specificity such as "debris", "clump", "low clump".

fields.name: sample_id
fields.description: Unique HuBMAP or SenNet identifier for the sample assigned by the ingest portal. Example: HBM743.CKJW.876 or SNT923.UYTE.122

fields.name: section_index_number
fields.description: The index number for the section if the sample is a single section.

fields.name: source_id
fields.description: Unique HuBMAP or SenNet identifier for the source (parent) from which the sample was taken. Example: HBM122.EFGH.789 or SNT234.RTYU.119

fields.name: source_storage_duration_unit
fields.description: The time duration unit of measurement

fields.name: source_storage_duration_value
fields.description: How long was the source material (parent) stored, prior to this sample being processed.

fields.name: specimen_preservation_temperature
fields.description: The temperature of the medium during the preservation process.

fields.name: specimen_quality_criteria
fields.description: For example, RIN: 8.7.

fields.name: specimen_tumor_distance_unit
fields.description: Distance unit

fields.name: specimen_tumor_distance_value
fields.description: If surgical sample, how far from the tumor was the sample obtained from. Typically a number of centimeters. Leave blank if not applicable or unknown.

fields.name: storage_medium
fields.description: What was the sample preserved in.

fields.name: storage_method
fields.description: The method by which the sample was stored, after preparation and before the assay was performed.

fields.name: suspension_entity_count
fields.description: Total number of cell/nuclei yielded post dissociation and enrichment.

fields.name: suspension_entity_type
fields.description: The type of single cell entity derived from isolation protocol.

fields.name: thickness_unit
fields.description: The thickness unit of measuement

fields.name: thickness_value
fields.description: Thickness of the sample section.

fields.name: tissue_weight_unit
fields.description: The tissue weight unit of measurement

fields.name: tissue_weight_value
fields.description: The weight of a tissue block or the piece of tissue used in a suspension. Knowing the weight of the parent block and tissue used in a suspension, allows us to compute what percentage of the block was used for the suspension.

fields.name: vital_state
fields.description: Identify the vital state of the donor.

fields.name: warm_ischemia_time_unit
fields.description: Time unit

fields.name: warm_ischemia_time_value
fields.description: Time interval between cessation of blood flow and cooling to 4C.
